description:
Sr. Director of Sales – Northeast Territory

Summary:

Reporting directly to the CEO, the Senior Director of Sales is accountable for fostering and enhancing relationships with customers across new and existing channels, while also providing value and insight to customers and the organization. This is achieved through a detailed understanding of the product portfolio, capabilities, constraints, and customer needs, with a focus on driving revenue growth and maximizing capacity utilization. Additionally, you will work to expand our market presence through targeted initiatives and industry presence. This role will be responsible for supporting the manufacture and sales of dairy-related products to clients across the Northeastern territory.

Scope:
• Strategic management and leadership of RFP’s, contract negotiations trade deals. Partner with finance around pricing execution.
• Synthesize customer, consumer, category, competitive and company insights into executable winning customer plans and tactics.
• Develop a comprehensive understanding of our product offerings, including production methodologies, capabilities, and technical properties.
• Effectively communicate the value proposition to customers and stakeholders, increasing our market presence.
• Provide proactive insights and leadership into the organization’s short-, medium- and long-term strategy, while leading its commercial execution.
• Lead the development and execution of comprehensive sales strategies, partnering with R&D & Operations, to drive revenue growth, optimize customer acquisition, and facilitate market expansion, all while diversifying our product portfolio to meet evolving market demands.
• Ownership of commercial KPI’s; define, track, and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure sales effectiveness and efficiency.
• Cultivate and maintain enduring partnerships with key clientele, empathetically comprehending their evolving needs and ensuring a consistently high standard of customer satisfaction through tailored service offerings.
• Mentor and assist in the development of the sales and marketing team.

Requirements:
• Travel in excess of 50% anticipated, interfacing with customers, participate in trade and industry events as needed. Must have a valid driver’s license.
• Bachelor’s degree required.
• 10+ years of demonstrated experience in senior business development roles within the dairy or food manufacturing industry.
• Knowledge of ESL/Aseptic highly desired.
• Understanding of Federal Milk Marketing Orders (FMMO) and Milk Pricing preferred

Salary is estimated to be at $140k to $165k + additional incentive compensation. Subject to level of experience and education.
